title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki on 19 September 2016 - XWiki
content:
<jonesmeier> has quit  
03:16 <jonesmeier> has joined #xwiki  
06:24 <sagarhani> has quit  
06:45 <sagarhani> has joined #xwiki  
07:04 <DarkKnightCZ> has joined #xwiki  
07:22 <msmeria> has joined #xwiki  
08:07 <Aranjedeath> has quit  
08:42 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
08:52 <acotiuga> has joined #xwiki  
09:09 <tmortagne> has joined #xwiki  
09:13 <mflorea> has joined #xwiki  
09:21 <martinus\_\_> hi there. About http://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/Code+Macro ; how am I supposed to know what is the language ID string from http://pygments.org/languages/ for "MoinMoin/Trac Wiki markup" for example ?  
09:37 <vmassol> martinus\_\_: by clikcking on the link on the first line :)  
09:37 <vmassol> "See http://pygments.org/languages/ for the list of all supported languages."  
09:37 <vmassol> (on the link you pasted ;))  
09:38 <martinus\_\_> vmassol, like {{code language="MoinMoin/Trac Wiki markup"}}  ?  
09:39 <martinus\_\_> what about "C, C++" ;)  
09:39 <vmassol> hmm indeed  
09:39 <martinus\_\_> that's my point  
09:39 <vmassol> well you should go on their mailing kist/forum to ask them  
09:39 <vmassol> because that's outside of xwiki  
09:41 <vmassol> I don't know the answer  
09:42 <tmortagne> mflorea: the jacoco error on platform 7.4.x seems related to your addition to oldcore for XWIKI-13700  
09:42 <vmassol> I see " come to the#pocoo channel on FreeNode."  
09:42 <vmassol> "You can also open an issue at thehttps://www.bitbucket.org/birkenfeld/pygments-main/issues/."  
09:43 <mflorea> tmortagne: I'll check  
09:43 <gdelhumeau> has joined #xwiki  
09:44 <tmortagne> martinus\_\_: you can inspect the html of the drom down on http://pygments.org/ but yes not very practical, they are indeed missing some explicit list of ids  
09:44 <tmortagne> s/drom/drop/  
09:48 <tmortagne> I guess we could use the python macro to list those available in xwiki.org, they probably have some API to list them all  
09:49 <tmortagne> but it would only be those available in the version xwiki.org is running on  
09:51 <tmortagne> now it's not too hard to just put the last version of Pygments on xwiki.org anyway  
10:06 <DarkKnightCZ> has quit  
10:12 <jihad[m]> has quit  
10:13 <mmercer> has quit  
10:15 <mmercer> has joined #xwiki  
10:18 <jihad[m]> has joined #xwiki  
10:27 <Pbas> has joined #xwiki  
10:43 <evalica> has joined #xwiki  
10:48 <tmortagne>   restarting xwiki.org  
10:51 <xwikibot> has joined #xwiki  
11:15 <vmassol> acotiuga: reviewing pr  
11:28 <vmassol> done  
11:37 <acotiuga> vmassol: updated the pr. thanks  
11:55 <vmassol> acotiuga: did you run with -Pquality to check javacoc?  
11:56 <jihad[m]> has quit  
11:57 <sorinello> has quit  
11:58 <sorinello> has joined #xwiki  
11:58 <tmortagne> vmassol:  I don't think you have javadoc with -Pquality  
11:58 <tmortagne> (we probably should but right now we execute the javadoc plugin only in release job I think)  
11:59 <acotiuga> I did run mvn clean install -Pquality and no failures regarding the javadoc  
11:59 <vmassol> ok great  
11:59 <acotiuga> I mean no failures at all  
11:59 <acotiuga> thanks for merging the pr  
11:59 <vmassol> since more code was added but not more tests  
12:00 <vmassol> there could have been a jacoco threshold issue  
12:01 <acotiuga> Could this change be ported to XWiki 7.4.5?  
12:02 <jihad[m]> has joined #xwiki  
12:02 <vmassol> I think it's acceptable yes since it's something new that doesn't interfere with anything else  
12:03 <tmortagne> yes it cannot really be dangerous  
12:45 <acotiuga> FYI, right now I'm working only on a fork of the xwiki-platform project and IIRC I don't have commit right on the project. Would anyone be available to cherry pick https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-platform/commit/2912698832f6a1fe2d1402b97802969284f16477 on 7.4.5?  
14:01 <DarkKnightCZ> has quit  
14:25 <xwikiorg\_guest\_8> has joined #xwiki  
14:26 <xwikiorg\_guest\_8> hi there guys, I've got a question, I've been trying to create a document tree fully expanded but I wasn't able to, is there any recommended way to do it?  
14:26 <xwikiorg\_guest\_8> I can't manage to show it expanded by defaulty  
14:26 <xwikiorg\_guest\_8> default\*  
14:27 <xwikiorg\_guest\_8> I've followed several examples in this article http://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/Document+Tree+Macro  
14:54 <vmassol> xwikiorg\_guest\_8: Not sure it's possible. Note that it's a bad idea to fully expand the tree since that would increase a lot the page loading time.  
14:58 <woshilapin> has joined #xwiki  
15:00 <xwikiorg\_guest\_8> Well can I expand several levels of a document tree?  
15:05 <bezourox> has joined #xwiki  
15:27 <msmeria> has quit  
15:29 <DarkKnightCZ> has joined #xwiki  
15:31 <DarkKnightCZ> has quit  
15:49 <bezourox> Hi. I installed LDAP Application 9.1 to configure my LDAP connection, but dont't work  
15:49 <bezourox> message :LDAP authentication is not enabled. Please set LDAP as authentication service in xwiki.cfg  
15:50 <bezourox> In this file, no modification if I save from GUI.  
15:52 <DarkKnightCZ> has joined #xwiki  
15:58 <bezourox> any idea ?  
16:00 <tmortagne> bezourox: see http://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/LDAP/Application/#HEnablingLDAPauthenticationonawiki  
16:03 <bezourox> tmortagne: thanks ! i readi it but same problem  
16:04 <bezourox> xwiki.authentication.authclass=com.xpn.xwiki.user.impl.LDAP.XWikiLDAPAuthServiceImpl uncommented but same  
16:06 <tmortagne> bezourox: did you restarted after modifying xwiki.cfg ?  
16:07 <bezourox> restarted tomcat  
16:07 <tmortagne> bezourox: what of XWiki are you using ?  
16:07 <bezourox> 8.2.1  
16:12 <tmortagne> bezourox: actually this is because version 9.1 of the application expect the new authenticator ("org.xwiki.contrib.ldap.XWikiLDAPAuthServiceImpl") and is only testing this one  
16:13 <tmortagne> it's installed as dependency of the application so you have it  
16:13 <tmortagne> you should probably give it a try since you will get new features and improvements compared to the core one  
16:14 <tmortagne> you can keep the core one if you wand and it will work, just ignore the warning  
16:14 <tmortagne> for now the application does not list features of the new authenticator so it should be ok but it might change  
16:18 <tmortagne> updating the documentation to make it more clear  
16:31 <bezourox> I dont't understand all explain, but seems to be normal :)  
16:32 <bezourox> having to comment LDAP section in xwiki.cfg that's right ?  
16:44 <tmortagne> bezourox: there is two different classes in http://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/LDAP/Application/#HEnablingLDAPauthenticationonawiki  
16:44 <tmortagne> the first one should be used with application 8.3+ and you are using 9.1 from what you said  
16:44 <tmortagne> the second one is the old authenticator  
16:44 <tmortagne> but it will work too  
16:45 <tmortagne> it's just that you will have the warning in the admin and you won't get new features/improvements  
16:45 <tmortagne> so better use the new one  
16:45 <bezourox> Ok I have to use new  
16:45 <bezourox> but complient 8.3+  
16:46 <tmortagne> this is the version of the application which is not in sync with the version of XWiki anymore  
16:47 <tmortagne> another possibility if you want to use the authenticator embedded in 8.2.1 and don't want to get a warning in the admin is to install the version 8.2.1 of the application  
16:48 <acotiuga> has quit  
16:48 <bezourox> maybe the better way..  
16:48 <bezourox> what do you think ?  
16:51 <tmortagne> bezourox: the embedded one does not have any know issue right now, just less features but if any bug is found it will be fixed only in the new one  
16:51 <tmortagne> and it's not embeded in XWiki 8.3  
16:51 <tmortagne> so if you use the embedded one you will have to change the configuration when you upgrade  
16:52 <tmortagne> if you use the new one upgrade won't have any impact since you will keep using the exact same authenticator  
16:53 <tmortagne> I would use the new one (but I wrote the new one :))  
17:04 <bezourox> ahah ok  
17:06 <bezourox> so I will use the new one (xwiki.authentication.authclass=com.xpn.xwiki.user.impl.LDAP.XWikiLDAPAuthServiceImpl), restart xwiki. Warning message will be present but connection to my Acitve Directory will good  
17:07 <tmortagne> that's the old once  
17:08 <tmortagne> and yes if you use the old one you will have a warning for it will work  
17:08 <tmortagne> (but you will have to modify xwiki.cfg to use the new one when you upgrade)  
17:10 <bezourox> xwiki.authentication.authclass=org.xwiki.contrib.ldap.XWikiLDAPAuthServiceImpl  
17:10 <bezourox> sorry  
17:11 <bezourox> xwiki.authentication.authclass=org.xwiki.contrib.ldap.XWikiLDAPAuthServiceImpl <-- no find in xwiki.cfg  
17:12 <tmortagne> yes what you have in xwiki.cfg is the old one  
17:13 <mflorea> has quit  
17:15 <bezourox> tmortagne: so I don't understand how to activate the new one  
17:15 <tmortagne> bezourox: you have two different classes  
17:16 <tmortagne> you see both of them in http://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/LDAP/Application/#HEnablingLDAPauthenticationonawiki  
17:16 <tmortagne> just change the class you have in xwiki.cfg with the new class  
17:16 <bezourox> ok thanks  
17:16 <tmortagne> you must have somewhere in xwiki.cfg  
17:16 <tmortagne> xwiki.authentication.authclass=org.xwiki.contrib.ldap.XWikiLDAPAuthServiceImpl  
17:22 <bezourox> tmortagne: OK now no warning message !  
17:22 <tmortagne> :)  
17:29 <bezourox> more easy done, have to configure now  
18:23 <tmortagne> has quit

23:25 <Aison> hmm, why have all users admin rights for my wiki?!
